thread.title: Man Utd transfer news: Michail Antonio not set on West Ham stay | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd transfer news: Michail Antonio not set on West Ham stay | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd transfer news: Michail Antonio not set on West Ham stay | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 2:06 pm SWANSEA, WALES – DECEMBER 26: MichGetty Images) 
Michail Antonio has offered Chelsea and Manchester United real hope of signing him by admitting he’s not sure if he will extend his stay at West Ham United. 
The 26-year-old has become a key part of Slaven Bilic’s side since joining from Nottingham Forest in 2015 and was even called-up to Sam Allardyce’s first and only England squad. 
He’s scored an impressive eight goals in 24 Premier League matches this season, while providing three assists for his team-mates and it’s no surprise that some of the country’s top clubs are interested in signing him. Conte and Mourinho have both been linked to Antonio (Picture: Getty) 
Despite big clubs sniffing around him, Antonio has insisted his head has not been turned, however, he would not commit to putting pen to paper on a new deal. 
‘Right now, nothing is really happening on the contract talks,’ he told Sky Sports.
